ygData.subject: Re: Assist Command?
ygData.msgSnippet: Assist is targeted on a friendly and then you automatically target whatever they are fighting when free ... From: Mott, Mike J.
ygData.messageBody:
Assist is targeted on a friendly and then you automatically target whatever
they are fighting when free

-----Original Message-----
From: Mott, Mike J. [mailto:MIKE.J.MOTT@...]
Sent: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 1:33 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: [eqbards] Assist Command?


From: "Mott, Mike J." <MIKE.J.MOTT@...>

The ASSIST command? Am I missing something here? I have never heard of
this.

--------------

Lullaby can be very useful if you have a rogue and healer in your group and
fighting multiple mobs. While you sleep the rest of the mobs, the rogue can

backstab the one you are fighting and the cleric can heal you. But I
usually don't use lullaby unless there is a healer in the group and everyone

in the group knows what the ASSIST command is for.


Lago Bardoon, 21st Rank Bard of Bertox
